mention.text: the chin '' gigante , the powerful mob boss who avoided jail for decades by wandering the greenwich village streets in a ratty bathrobe and slippers as part of an elaborate feigned mental illness
the powerful mob boss who avoided jail for decades by wandering the greenwich village streets in a ratty bathrobe and slippers as part of an elaborate feigned mental illness
part of an elaborate feigned mental illness
the `` oddfather '' for his bizarre behavior
an ex - boxer whose lengthy string of victories over prosecutors ended with a july 1997 racketeering conviction
the federal prison in springfield - the same facility where rival mob boss john gotti died
the victim of his own crazy act
a brazen act to avoid the law - although it was n't until 1997 that a jury agreed
a chance to enjoy the fruits of his plunder
the man described by the new york times magazine as `` the last great mafioso of the century
the final act in a 50 - year career spanning the era of the old - time , publicity - shy `` mustache petes '' and the modern - day mafia of the swaggering gotti
six turncoat mobsters , led by ex - gotti
gigante of racketeering , extortion and plotting the murder - never carried out - of ex - mob associate peter savino
sentencing gigante to 12 years in prison
a major blow to a mafia
the hitman in a botched attempt to assassinate then - boss frank costello
vito genovese , kingpin of the family
his priest - brother and most ardent defender
